item.title: The more specific the mobile advertisement, the higher its earnings
item.description:
Smaato, a mobile advertising company, has observed that the most successful advertising categories in China during the first quarter of the year were shopping, e-commerce, communication, and technology. These categories achieved high eCPMs (effective cost per mille), reaching up to US$0.30. When analyzing mobile real-time bidding (RTB) ad expenditures in China during the same period, entertainment (30%) and games (22%) were the top two categories. Ajitpal Pannu, Smaato’s Chief Strategy Officer, noted that both monetization and brand spending increased when essential parameters were shared globally with advertising partners...

item.title: Criteo provides a mobile advertising solution that allows ads to be displayed within mobile apps
item.description:
Everyone wants to advertise on smartphones and tablets, but it’s not as easy as it sounds. Research from Flurry shows that mobile users are primarily engaged with specific apps, like email or Facebook, rather than browsing the mobile web. This limits the opportunities for advertisers to reach their target audiences. Criteo, a company specializing in performance display advertising, has developed a solution to this challenge. They’ve launched a beta version of their mobile in-app performance display advertising solution, offering businesses a cost-effective way to engage with and convert mobile users...

item.description:

item.title: Facebook introduces a user-friendly, streamlined video advertising format
item.description:
Over one-third of mobile internet users in Saudi Arabia are receptive to video advertisements, exceeding the global average of 22%. Facebook is introducing “Slideshow,” a new, user-friendly video ad format designed to increase reach across various devices and connection speeds. In a blog post announcing Slideshow, Facebook highlights a recent report indicating that people in regions like the Philippines, where connectivity can be slow, costly, or both, and where feature phones are common, are even more receptive to video ads...
